Package org.hiphap

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CsvPrintable
    Any class implementing this interface is expected to return a single line String object containing the CVS formatted data within a particular object of that class
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Arrangement
    This class inherits the Event class, and adds the ability to hold other events within itself.
    ConsoleManager
    This class is responsible for creating a single instance of Scanner that is accessible from all throughout the system, to be used for user input
    Employee
    This class represents a HipHapOrg employee within the system, thus making it easier for it to be reused under several different events.
    EmployeeManager
    This class uses the singleton pattern to allow easy access to the Employee data from any point within the system.
    Entity
    Abstract base class for Person and Organization to hold common attributes and behaviour, and allow for polymorphic handling of the subclasses.
    Event
    This class represents within the system a singular event organized by HipHapOrg on behalf of one or more clients.
    EventManager
    This class uses the singleton pattern to allow easy access to the Event data from any point within the system.
    EventResource
    This class represents a good or a service that's purchased or hired for an event
    EventType
    This class represents one category of events in the system.
    EventTypeManager
    This class uses the singleton pattern to allow easy access to the EventType data from any point within the system.
    FileManager
    This class only holds static methods meant to help with writing to and reading from files on disk.
    Logger
    This class was used during development for easily writing error messages to log files.
    Main
    This class is the main entry point in the program.
    Organization
    This class represents an organization that the system keeps track of, making it easier for it to be reused under several different events.
    OrganizationManager
    This class uses the singleton pattern to allow easy access to the Organization data from any point within the system.
    Person
    This class represents a person that the system keeps track of, making it easier for the associated data to be reused under several different events.
    PersonManager
    This class uses the singleton pattern to allow easy access to the Person data from any point within the system.
    User
    A class to represent a username and password combination used to authenticate on the system.
    UserManager
    This class uses the singleton pattern to allow easy User authentication, and management from any point within the system.
